result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. Davel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation in 15CM115 to run concurrent with Probation in 15CM21

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Bond previously posted applied to this case and 15CM21

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  

The defendant shall have no contact with D.D.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way without prior approval of the agent and permission of the victim.

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is ordered to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions, if not yet done.  The DNA surcharge has already been paid.
Concurrent with: Jail sentence on case 15CM21 Ct 1 and Ct 3

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

The defendant shall have no contact with  D.D. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
